meanings.definition: To join or bind with mortar.
meanings.sent1: The bricks were mortared together to build a strong wall.
meanings.sent2: The mason carefully mortared each stone in place.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mortared acorns into the cracks of the sidewalk.
meanings.sent4: Her words mortared a bond of trust between them.
meanings.sent5: The chef expertly mortared the ingredients in the bowl to make a delicious pesto sauce.

meanings.sent1: The old well was mortared shut to prevent accidents.
meanings.sent2: The ancient castle walls were mortared and sturdy.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten left mortared paw prints on the freshly painted porch.
meanings.sent4: The memories were mortared in her heart, never to be forgotten.
meanings.sent5: The statue stood mortared in place, a symbol of strength and endurance.
